metadata.Title: CVE-2023-4389 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium
metadata.Description:
A flaw was found in btrfs_get_root_ref in fs/btrfs/disk-io.c in the btrfsfilesystem in the Linux Kernel due to a double decrement of the referencecount. This issue may allow a local attacker with user privilege to crashthe system or may lead to leaked internal kernel information.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-4389` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.15.0-35-generic - 5.15.0-35.36
linux-image-5.15.0-35-generic-lpae - 5.15.0-35.36
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-35-generic - 5.15.0-35.36
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-35-generic-64k - 5.15.0-35.36
No subscription required

linux-image-5.19.0-28-generic - 5.19.0-28.29~22.04.1
linux-image-5.19.0-28-generic-lpae - 5.19.0-28.29~22.04.1

criterions.comment: linux package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-35.36').
linux-hwe-5.19 package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.19.0-28.29~22.04.1').
linux-kvm package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1008.8').
